Left.description: Left aligned, regardless of the current locale's writing direction.
Left.helpDescription: Left aligned, regardless of the current locale's writing direction.

Begin.description: Aligned towards the beginning of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.
Begin.helpDescription: Aligned towards the beginning of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.

Right.description: Right aligned, regardless of the current locale's writing direction.
Right.helpDescription: Right aligned, regardless of the current locale's writing direction.

End.description: Aligned towards the end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.
End.helpDescription: Aligned towards the end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.

Begin.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the beginning of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its end.
Begin.helpDescription: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the beginning of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its end.

End.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its beginning.
End.helpDescription: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its beginning.

Both.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards both the beginning and end of a line.
Both.helpDescription: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards both the beginning and end of a line.

Neither.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. No padding towards neither the beginning nor end of a line.
Neither.helpDescription: Top and bottom padding of 2px. No padding towards neither the beginning nor end of a line.

Small.description: A small (17px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.
Small.helpDescription: A small (17px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

SmallWithLine.description: A small (17px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.
SmallWithLine.helpDescription: A small (17px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

Medium.description: A medium (31px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.
Medium.helpDescription: A medium (31px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

Large.description: A large (63px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.
Large.helpDescription: A large (63px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

LargeWithLine.description: A large (63px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.
LargeWithLine.helpDescription: A large (63px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

None.description: No gutter at all (0px), and without a vertical line, of course.
None.helpDescription: No gutter at all (0px), and without a vertical line, of course.

MediumWithLine.description: A medium (31px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.
MediumWithLine.helpDescription: A medium (31px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

fieldHelpDisplay.description: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.
fieldHelpDisplay.helpDescription: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.

sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell.description: Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.
sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/MatrixLayoutCell. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign} : sap.zen.commons.BackgroundDesign (default: 'Transparent')
    • {@link #getColSpan colSpan} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getHAlign hAlign} : sap.zen.commons.HAlign (default: 'Begin')
    • {@link #getPadding padding} : sap.zen.commons.Padding (default: 'End')
    • {@link #getRowSpan rowSpan} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getSeparation separation} : sap.zen.commons.Separation (default: 'None')
    • {@link #getVAlign vAlign} : sap.zen.commons.VAlign (default: 'Middle')
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.ui.layout.Grid control.
Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

formatError.name: formatError
formatError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

parseError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationSuccess.helpDescription: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

modelContextChange.helpDescription: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

fieldHelpDisplay.helpDescription: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.

sap.zen.commons.layout.PositionContainer.description: Is used to specify the position of a control in the AbsoluteLayout
sap.zen.commons.layout.PositionContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/PositionContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTop top} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getBottom bottom} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getLeft left} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getRight right} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getCenterHorizontally centerHorizontally} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getCenterVertically centerVertically} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getControl control} : sap.ui.core.Control (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.zen.commons.layout.PositionContainer.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.89 the concept has been discarded.
Is used to specify the position of a control in the AbsoluteLayout

In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. sap.zen.commons.name: sap.zen.commons
sap.zen.commons.description: Design Studio Commons Library. Intended only to be used within S/4 HANA Fiori applications.
sap.zen.commons.helpDescription: Design Studio Commons Library. Intended only to be used within S/4 HANA Fiori applications.

fieldHelpDisplay.description: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.
fieldHelpDisplay.helpDescription: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.

sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayout.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/MatrixLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getLayoutFixed layoutFixed} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : int
    • {@link #getWidths widths} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize[]
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getRows rows} : sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayout.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.ui.layout.Grid control.
undefined

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

columns.description: Number of columns. If not specified, the number of columns will be determined from the given cells.
columns.helpDescription: Number of columns. If not specified, the number of columns will be determined from the given cells.

widths.description: Widths of the columns. Use an array to define the widths of the columns. If a column shall have an automatical sizing enter "auto" for this column width.
widths.helpDescription: Widths of the columns. Use an array to define the widths of the columns. If a column shall have an automatical sizing enter "auto" for this column width.

layoutFixed.description: Sets the table layout. If fixed the width parameter of a column has priority, if not the width of the content of the colums has priority. The default is "fixed". If the fixed layout is used a adequate width of the MatrixLayout should be provided. Otherwise the column width displayed could be different than the given ones because of browser dependend optimazations.
layoutFixed.helpDescription: Sets the table layout. If fixed the width parameter of a column has priority, if not the width of the content of the colums has priority. The default is "fixed". If the fixed layout is used a adequate width of the MatrixLayout should be provided. Otherwise the column width displayed could be different than the given ones because of browser dependend optimazations.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

blocked.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.
blocked.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

DeprecatedInfo.description: The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

width.description: CSS width of the matrix layout. If the LayoutFixed = true a adequate width should be provided.
width.helpDescription: CSS width of the matrix layout. If the LayoutFixed = true a adequate width should be provided.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

height.description: CSS height of the matrix layout.
height.helpDescription: CSS height of the matrix layout.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

formatError.name: formatError
formatError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

parseError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.

validationSuccess.name: validationSuccess
validationSuccess.description: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.helpDescription: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

modelContextChange.name: modelContextChange
modelContextChange.description: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.helpDescription: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validateFieldGroup.name: validateFieldGroup
validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
validateFieldGroup.helpDescription: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
validateFieldGroup.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationError.name: validationError
validationError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

fieldHelpDisplay.description: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.
fieldHelpDisplay.helpDescription: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.

sap.zen.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout.description: The Absolute Layout positions its child controls absolutely
sap.zen.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/AbsoluteLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "100%")
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "100%")
    • {@link #getVerticalScrolling verticalScrolling} : sap.ui.core.Scrolling (default: Hidden)
    • {@link #getHorizontalScrolling horizontalScrolling} : sap.ui.core.Scrolling (default: Hidden)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPositions positions} : sap.zen.commons.layout.PositionContainer[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.zen.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 the concept has been discarded.
The Absolute Layout positions its child controls absolutely

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

positions.description: Positioned child controls within the layout
positions.helpDescription: Positioned child controls within the layout

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

horizontalScrolling.description: 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode.
horizontalScrolling.helpDescription: 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode.

verticalScrolling.description: 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode.
verticalScrolling.helpDescription: 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

blocked.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.
blocked.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

DeprecatedInfo.description: The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.

sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow.description: Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.
sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/MatrixLayoutRow. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCells cells} : sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.ui.layout.Grid}.
Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.
